title: Drawing, "Project: The elevation of a sepulchral monument for a Medici cardinal", ca. 1560–70
medium: Incised lines.  Black chalk.  Pen, brush; bistre.  Paper.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectange.  Below is a dado which is shown in bird's-eye view.  Upon a pedestal with the tablet for the inscription, of which the letters "D O M" are inserted, and which is framed by pilasters with trophies of shields, stands the sarcophagus.  Upon it lies a cloth, the prelate, wearing a tunic and the mitre.  An escutcheon with six roundlets, 3, 2, 1.  A pedestal rises behind the figure.  Above is a group of the Virgin and the Child, who stands beside her upon a bench.  Candelabra stand in the right front; and the left back corners.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project: The elevation of a sepulchral monument for a Medici cardinal", ca. 1560–70.
ca. 1560–70. Incised lines.  Black chalk.  Pen, brush; bistre.  Paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2462.
